item.title: Comment on Avian Flu is Bad for Cows by Hadur
item.description:
I assume that like all MR comment threads about diseases, this will quickly turn into people airing their grievances about the COVID response and everything else will be aggressively downvoted.

I think it's important to understand that if avian flu does become transmissible between humans, it will have different features than COVID. And lessons learned from COVID may or may not apply.

A notable feature of COVID is that the older your age, the higher your risk of death. The very young - children - were spared. This is not how, say, the Spanish Flu worked. There, healthy young people with good immune systems died because of cytokine storms. And most diseases throughout history definitely did not spare the very young. We are not prepared emotionally for a pandemic that kills kids.

I do worry that if this thing spreads to people, we'll treat it like COVID when in fact it would likely follow different rules.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/09/avian-flu-is-bad-for-cows.html?commentID=160815805

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/09/avian-flu-is-bad-for-cows.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=avian-flu-is-bad-for-cows

Votes: 64⬆ 4⬇
item.dc:creator: Hadur

item.title: Comment on Why “Buy American” is not such a great idea by Tyler Adams
item.description:
Who said Buy American is about "Helping Americans" in terms of cost minimization and protectionist job handouts?

Buy American is about reenabling American production capabilities, which your arguments agree with!
